page.title: 04History Of Sorbie Village
page.content: Sorbie village is full of {local {history}.It got its name from the Saxons. They named it "Sour-by" because the land where they lived was so marshy that they were unable to grow crops on it. That is why they thought the land was sour. Through the years, the name was altered until it became "Sorbie". The two{Churches}in Sorbie were built many years ago. One is now an antique shop. It used to be a Reformist Church. The other one which is in the old grave yard was a Presbyterian Church. It is no longer used. The grave stone of the first school teacher to teach at Sorbie is situated in this grave yard. The {monument}in Sorbie was put up in memory of the soldiers who died in the first and second world wars. These men lived in the district of Sorbie.
